Class BaseState

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.PlayerStates.PlayerState
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.PlayerStates.BaseState
public class BaseState extends PlayerState
BaseState represents a specific state of a player in the game. It extends the abstract PlayerState class and defines the behavior and commands allowed during this state. The BaseState allows all commands provided in its implementation and defines a default behavior for creating commands and transitioning to the appropriate client-side state.

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseState

      public BaseState()
      Default constructor for the BaseState class. This constructor initializes a new instance of BaseState, which represents a state where the player is allowed to perform various commands, such as LoginCommand, ReadyCommand, and QuitCommand. The state defines default behavior for command permissions and transitions to corresponding client-side states.

  • Method Details

    • allows

      public boolean allows(LoginCommand command)
      Determines whether the given LoginCommand is allowed in the current player state.
      Overrides:
      allows in class PlayerState
      Parameters:
      command - the LoginCommand to be checked for allowance.
      Returns:
      true if the LoginCommand is permitted in the current state, false otherwise.

    • allows

      public boolean allows(ReadyCommand command)
      Determines whether the given ReadyCommand is allowed in the current player state. This method provides logic to verify if the specified ReadyCommand can be executed in the context of this state.
      Overrides:
      allows in class PlayerState
      Parameters:
      command - the ReadyCommand object to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the ReadyCommand is allowed, false otherwise

    • createDefaultCommand

      public Command createDefaultCommand(String gameId, Player player)
      Creates a default command for the player in the current game. This method generates a ReadyCommand with the required parameters to indicate the player's readiness in the game.
      Specified by:
      createDefaultCommand in class PlayerState
      Parameters:
      gameId - the unique identifier of the game.
      player - the player for whom the default command is being created.
      Returns:
      a ReadyCommand object containing the necessary details about the player's readiness.

    • toClientState

      public PhaseEvent toClientState()
      Transforms the current state into its client-side representation by generating a PhaseEvent object. The PhaseEvent encapsulates a BaseStateClient instance, which represents the corresponding client-side state of the game.
      Specified by:
      toClientState in class PlayerState
      Returns:
      a PhaseEvent containing a BaseStateClient object that represents the client-side state associated with the current game state.
